@ oxycodone - You should know that the 8 reference frames are coupled with the format profile's that are @L5.1, and appropriate for that. The 4 reference frames are only in the @L4.1 format profile encodes, and appropriate for those too. You can always re-encode if you are that desperate to use a clunky and cumbersome BluRay player. 

If you want to go a little higher tech, get a Popcorn Hour and remux all your .mkvs to get rid of the unwanted subs and audio tracks. I even re-title mine so I know exactly what I'm watching and the audio encoder it uses (e.g. DTS, AAC, Dolby 5.1 etc.) and the exact resolution (e.g. 816, 544 etc.)

BluRay. Only good thing about the set up is that the discs are heaven-sent for us High Def pirates. As for 3-D,-isn't it brilliant that .mkv3 has been engineered for those who have a PCH and a 3D TV.

All hail Pirates.
p.s. Thanks NLUPPER. Nice upload. All BluRay's are far better quality than the now defunct HD DVD's (which I first had of this boxset.)
